dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 7096 IH: To amend the Tariff Act of 1930 to enhance the authority of U.S. Customs and Border Protection to share information with respect to merchandise suspected of violating intellectual property rights with rights holders and other interested parties.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Buck introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Tariff Act of 1930 to enhance the authority of U.S. Customs and Border Protection to share information with respect to merchandise suspected of violating intellectual property rights with rights holders and other interested parties.

section.header: Enhanced authority to share information with respect to merchandise suspected of violating intellectual property rights
section.text: Section 628A of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1628a) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking paragraph (1) and inserting the following:
shall provide to the person information that appears on the merchandise, including—

subparagraph.text: its packaging, materials, and containers, including labels; and
its packing materials and containers, including labels; and
in paragraph (3), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in paragraph (4), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: any other party with an interest in the merchandise, as determined appropriate by the Commissioner.
